page.title: 03ARCHITECTURE OF LEAMINGTON.
page.content: The architecture of Leamington seems to me to fall into three main categories. They are as follows: {1.}Early 19th century Georgian style houses built when Leamington was at its height as a Spa town. Many of these houses were built in terraces, some of which have survived, for example Lansdowne Crescent. {2.}Buildings of the 1950's and 60's. In this period many flats were erected in the form of multiple-storey tower blocks. Some of these, as elsewhere, are now in a terrible state of repair. How long will they survive? {3.}The new estates.In the past ten years large estates of modern houses, all very similar in design, have been built in such areas as Sydenham. Architects are now designing houses which are more in keeping with the old buildings eg. mock Georgian style.
